metadata.title: CVE-2016-9643 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: The regex code in Webkit 2.4.11 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) as demonstrated in a large number of ($ (open parenthesis and dollar) followed by {-2,16} and a large number of +) (plus close parenthesis).

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.16.1-1').
